collection_holder_name: Archives of African American Music and Culture
pageContext.collection_description: Series G, "Music Industry Interviews," consists of transcripts and audiocassettes of interviews primarily conducted by Portia K. Maultsby between 1981-1986 as part of her research on the Black music industry. The remainder of the series in this collection are still in the process of being accessioned and are unavailable for general research and public use.
collectionFormats: Optical disc (Including CD, CD-R, CD-RW, DVD, DVD-R, DVD-RW, VCD)
pageContext.collection_usage_statement: The collector/donor has granted permission for in-house use only. Researchers may not quote or reproduce any part of this collection without explicit permission from the creator. Other copyrights and intellectual property rights may also apply. With the exception of Series G, "Music Industry Interviews," the use of this collection is restricted to students enrolled in Maultsby's courses for educational purposes or other parties receiving her explicit permission. Contact AAAMC staff for details.
physical_formats: Optical disc (Including CD, CD-R, CD-RW, DVD, DVD-R, DVD-RW, VCD)
subjects: African American sound recording executives and producers
